channel.title: NPR Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Mart√≠nez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: The Trump administration issues new guidance, suggesting a link between acetaminophen use and autism, ABC says Jimmy Kimmel's show will return Tuesday, Trump will meet with world leaders at UNGA.

item.title: Despite lack of evidence, Trump suggests link between acetaminophen use and autism
item.description: The Trump administration announced Monday that the FDA will be updating drug labelling to discourage the use of acetaminophen by pregnant women, suggesting a link between the painkiller and autism.

item.title: Expert weighs in on Trump administration's guidance linking acetaminophen and autism
item.description: Helen Tager Flusberg, director of Boston University's Center for Autism Research Excellence, talks about the Trump administration's claim linking acetaminophen and autism.

item.title: Some mobile home owners say they're being priced out by rising lot rent
item.description: Rent prices for lots in manufactured or mobile home parks are on the rise, according to census data. Some home owners say the increases are pricing them out of the homes they own.

item.title: Ukrainian teachers and students keep education alive despite war
item.description: Thousands of Ukrainian schools have been destroyed in the war with Russia, forcing teachers and students underground. They'll share their stories of keeping education alive at UNGA Tuesday.

item.title: Closing arguments to begin in trial of man accused of trying to assassinate Trump
item.description: Closing arguments will begin Tuesday in the trial of Ryan Routh, the man charged with trying to assassinate Donald Trump last year on his Florida golf course.

item.title: Trump says civil confinement should be used to get the unhoused off the streets
item.description: A plan backed by President Trump could force far more unhoused Americans into long-term treatment for addiction and mental illness. Experts fear people who aren't dangerous could be swept up.

item.title: Some Americans wanted to leave the country after Trump's reelection. But did they?
item.description: After President Trump was elected to a second term, a number of Americans spoke of wanting to leave the country. NPR looks into whether people followed through with obtaining a new passport.

item.title: Super typhoon Ragasa heads to Hong Kong, southern China after lashing Philippines
item.description: A super typhoon barreled through northern Philippines Monday, displacing over 17,000 people. The storm is now bearing down on Hong Kong and southern China.

item.title: President Trump to discuss his foreign policy priorities with world leaders at UNGA
item.description: President Trump will meet with world leaders Tuesday to discuss his foreign policy priorities at the UN General Assembly.
